What is the reason for this?? 

Harald

Looking at JobViewLabelProvider.java:29 it seems that IGridJob#getJobStatus() may return null which was not yet handled in the JobViewLabelProvider. I changed the corresponding line of code to check the job status against null and to return an empty string in that case. So this should fix the NullPointerException for now. Nevertheless I assign this bug to Pawel in order to have a deeper look if the GridJob#getJobStatus() may really return null. In my oppinion this method should never return null but maybe a dedicated job status object that says "Status not available" if no job status is currently available.

What I made concerning this bug:
1. now eu.geclipse.grid.resources.GridJob.getJobStatus() return static object GridJobStatus.UNKNOWN_STATUS, when status is null.

2. I checked all places where getJobStatus() was called to see if any sourcecode rely on null status: 
only eu.geclipse.grid.ui.decorators.GridJobDecorator.decorate(Object, IDecoration) had to be changed

3. I checked also GlobusJob and VirtualGlobusJob. These classes always returns any status object - in worst case "unknown". So these classes cannot return null status.
